titles.title: Säʿatat zä-lelit wä-zä-nägh “Horologium for the Night and the Morning Hours”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Säʿatat zä-lelit wä-zä-nägh “Horologium for the Night and the Morning Hours” (fols. 3r-56r) I-1) Introductory prayers and hymns (fols. 3r-14r) - Halle luya… ʾaʿattǝb wä-ʾǝtnäśśaʿ bä-sǝmä ʾab… “Hallelujah… I make the sign of the cross and stand up in the name of the Father…” (Introductory prayer) (fols. 3r-4v) - Gǝnäyu lä-ʾǝgziʾabǝḥer… “Serve the Lord…” (Hymn to God) (fols. 4v-5v) - Rǝḫuqä mäʾat… “Far from anger…” (Prayer) (fols. 5v-6v) - ʾƎweddǝsäkki ʾo-dǝngǝl… “I praise You, o Virgin…” (Hymn to St. Mary) (fols. 6v-7r) - Täzäkkär ʾǝgziʾo kidanä… “Remember, O Lord, the covenant…” (Hymn to the Lord) (fols. 7r-8r) - Nǝʿi ḫabeyä ʾo-dǝngǝl… “Come to me, O Virgin…” (Hymn to St. Mary) (fols. 8r-9v) - Nǝsebb[ǝḥo] lä-ʾǝgziʾabǝḥer… “We praise the Lord…” (Praise of God) (fols. 9v-11r) - Gänäynä lä-ki ʾo-wälättä Dawit… “We have served You, O daughter of Dawit…” (Hymn to St. Mary) (fols. 11r-11v) - Sǝʾalu lä-nä… “Pray for us…” (Hymn to the saints and angels) (fols. 11v-14r). I-2) Readings (fols. 14r-17r) - for Monday (fols. 14r-16v) - for Sunday (fols. 16v-17r) I-3) Principal prayers and hymns (fols. 17r-56r) - Kwǝllomu śärawitä mälaʾǝkt mänfäsawǝyan… “All hosts of the spiritual angels… ” (Hymn to God) (fols. 17r-19v) - Mogäs wä-kǝbrǝnä qärnä mädḫanitǝnä... “Grace and our glory, the horn of our salvation…” (Hymn to the Trinity) (fols. 19v-25v) - Sälam lä-ki Maryam lä-Noḫ ḥa[mä]ru… “Salutation to You Mary, Noah’s Ark… ” (Hymn to St. Mary) (fols. 25v-30v) - Täfäśśǝḥi Maryam Fasika lä-ʾAddam… “Rejoice, Mary, Adam’s Easter…” (fols. 30v-36r) - Täʾabǝyo näfsǝyä lä-ʾǝgziʾabǝḥer. Säʾali lä-nä Maryam… “My soul extolls God. Pray for us Mary…” (Prayer to St. Mary) (fols. 36r-41r) - Säʾal lä-nä Giyorgis näʿa näʿa näʿa näʿa Giyorgis… “Pray for us George; come, come, come, come George… ” (Hymn to the saints, angels, etc.) (fols. 41r-44v) - Mäḥarännä ʾAb. Hale luya. Täśahalännä Wäld. Hale luya Mänfäs Qǝddus… “Have compassion upon us, Father. Hallelujah. Have mercy upon us, Son. Hallelujah Holy Spirit…” (Prayer to the Trinity) (fols. 44v-45v) - Täśahalkä ʾǝgziʿo… “You had mercy, o Lord…” (Prayer to God) (fols. 45v-46v) - Täfäśśǝḥi ʾo-Maryam mǝlǝʾtä ṣägga… “Rejoice, o Mary, full of grace…” (Hymn to St. Mary) (fols. 46v-47r) - ʾO-rǝḫrǝḫtä ḥǝllina… “O tender-hearted...” (Hymn to St. Mary) (fols. 47r-48r) - Sälam lä-sǝʾlǝki zä-yǝʾeddǝm lä-nǝṣṣare… “Salutation to Your icon which is pleasant to the sight…” (Greeting to the Icon of the Virgin Mary) (fols. 48r-50v) - Hale luya nǝsgǝd lä-ʾabä bǝrhanat… “Hallelujah, let us worship the Lord of the lights...” (fols. 50v-53r) - ʾƎsebbǝḥ ṣäggaki ʾo-mǝlǝʾtä ṣägga... “I praise Your grace, o full of grace…” (Hymn to St. Mary) (fols. 53r-54v) - Kwǝllomu śärawitä mälaʿǝktä mänfäsawǝyan… “All hosts of the spiritual angels…” (Hymn to St. Mary) (fols. 55r-56r)
Additiones 1-3.

owners.owner: The names [Wälä]ttä Täklä Haymanot, [G]äbrä Täklä Haymanot, Wäldä Maryam are written on fol. 56r.

txstates.txstate: Several leaves are worn and affected by humidity, e.g., fols. 27r, 19v, 20r.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the centre fold of the quires, close to the tail and head of the codex.

squires.squire: A (2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(6/fols. 27r-32v) – V(8/fols. 33r-40v) – VI(7; s.l.: 2, stub after 6/fols. 41r-47v) - VII(8/fols. 48r-55v) – B(2/fols. 56r-57v).

taunit.ln-info: the number changes: e.g., it is 18 in fol. 4r, 24 in fols. 14r, 18r, 25 in fol. 23r
taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Several times, the scribe disregarded the ruling (e.g., fols. 33v, 34r). The layout is not uniform.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ማርያ፡ for ማርያም፡ (e.g., fols. 22v, 24v) ሰ፡/ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡ (e.g., fol. 25v) ሰ፡/ሰዓ፡ for ሰአሉ፡ (fols. 12r-14r) ሰ፡/ሰዓ፡ for ሰአሊለነ፡ (fols. 38r-40v) ሰ፡ for ሰአልነ፡ (fols. 41r-44r) ዘዘሐ፡ for ዘዘእሑድ፡ (?) (fol. 14r) ዘዘሰኑ፡ for ዘዘሰኑይ፡ (?) (fol. 16v) ግብ፡ for ግብረ፡ (?) (fol. 16v) ተ፡ እ፡ (?) (fol. 16v) ጥዑ፡ for ጥዑመ፡ (fol. 16v) ንሴብ፡ for ንሴብሖ፡ (fol. 9v) ቅ፡ ቅ፡ ቅ፡ for ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ (e.g., fols. 2v, 4r, 10v) በ፡ ሰ፡ for በሰጊድ፡ (fols. 27r-28v) ገነ፡ for ገነይነለኪ፡ (fol. 11v).

otherdetails.otherdetail: - About the text “Mäṣḥafä Säʿatat” and the different versions, cp. EAE V, 501-503. The text in Ms. QMM-003 seems to belong to the category described as S.2. - The text is very similar to Ms. MR-027. - The Ms. contains most of the prayers and hymns of the edition Mäṣḥafä Säʿatat, bä-gǝˤǝzǝnna bä-ʾamarǝñña. Zä-lelit wä-zä-nägh, Addis Abäba 1952 A.M. [1960 A.D.]. A similar text is contained in Ms. EMML 2096, fols. 84r-125v.

additional.cont: Fol. 1v: Hymn to St. Mary.
additional.add: Fol. 1v: [እ]ሴብህ፡ ጸጋኪ፡…
additional.tran: Fol. 1v: I praise Your grace...
additional.det: Hymn from the “Säʿatat”. Written in a recent hand (in dark crimson ink), incomplete.

additional.cont: Fol. 2r: Hymn to St. Mary.
additional.add: Fol. 2r: ተፈሲሒ፡ ማርያም፡…
additional.det: Hymn from the “Säʿatat”. Crudely written in pencil, incomplete.

additional.cont: Fol. 2v: Hymn to St. Mary.
additional.tran: Fol. 2v: All hosts of the spiritual angels…
additional.det: Written in a recent hand, incomplete. The same hymn has been started to be written on fol. 2r (above Additio 2).

extras.extra: - The word ድንግል፡ (“Virgin”) is written (in black ink, by the scribe) in the upper margin of fol. 47v; the word በከመ፡ (“Like, as”) is written upside down (in black ink, by the scribe) in the bottom margin of fol. 48v. - Several names are written in red ink in the same hand as the main text on fol. 56r, at the end of the text: [ወለ]ተ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ [ገብ]ረ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ወልደ፡ ማርያም።, [Wälä]ttä Täklä Haymanot, [G]äbrä Täklä Haymanot, Wäldä Maryam. - A note mentioning the title ውእቱ፡ ሰአታት፡ ዘቤተ፡ ክርስትያን፡ “This is the Hours of the church”, and a personal name in Latin script, Kahsay, are written (recently; in pencil) on fol. 57r. - The title of the work (ሠአታት) is written in pen in the upper margin of fol. 1r. - A simple black line is used as text divider on fols. 50v and 56r. - Corrections (words or letters) are written interlineally and in the margins: fols. 14v, 54v. - Immediate corrections indicated by thin lines above and below the word: fols. 5r, 48r. - Erasures: fols. 8r, 10r. - Crude minor notes: fols. 1r, 19v, 20v, 22r, 23r, 25v, 26r, 29r, 30v, 33v, 34r, 57v. - Crude drawing on fol. 1r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - For the readings of Monday and Sunday, the indications of the days have been wrongly inverted as follows: for Monday ዘዘእሑድ፡ (abbreviated in ዘዘሐ፡), for Sunday ዘዘሰኑይ፡ (ዘዘሰኑ፡) (s. fols. 14r and 16v). the references to specific hours are not given and the title is not mentioned.

frames.frame: Fol. 3r (incipit page): simple, coloured (red and black) ornamental band, with two lateral extensions reaching the bottom of the page; geometrical motifs. Fol. 30v: simple, coloured (red and black) text divider. Fol. 36r: simple text divider, with two lateral extensions reaching the bottom of the page; geometrical motifs.
